data.terraform fmt: Rewrites config files to canonical format
data.terraform get: Download and install modules for the configuration
data.terraform graph: Create a visual graph of Terraform resources
data.terraform output: Read an output from a state file
data.terraform plan: Generate and show an execution plan
data.terraform providers: Prints a tree of the providers used in the configuration
data.terraform push: Upload this Terraform module to Atlas to run
data.terraform refresh: Update local state file against real resources
data.terraform taint: Manually mark a resource for recreation
data.terraform untaint: Manually unmark a resource as tainted

Description:
The available commands for execution are listed below.
The most common, useful commands are shown first, followed by
less common or more advanced commands. If you're just getting
started with Terraform, stick with the common commands. For the
other commands, please read the help and docs before usage.
